measured_by: Mini Mood and Anxiety Symptoms Questionnaire – Anhedonic Depression subscale (Mini-MASQ-AD)
justification: The paper repeatedly refers to "the MASQ anhedonic depression subscale (hereafter 'anhedonia')", showing that anhedonia was measured with the Mini-MASQ-AD instrument.
In the questionnaire list it notes "Apathy Evaluation Scale (AES)", demonstrating AES was used to measure apathy.
The Self-report Measures section includes "State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)", identifying STAI as the measure for state and trait anxiety symptoms.
The article lists "Obsessive Compulsive Inventory ‑Revised (OCIR)", linking OCIR to the assessment of obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
The battery included "Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale (LSAS)", indicating LSAS measured social anxiety.
"Barratt Impulsivity Scale (BIS)" appears in the questionnaire list, showing BIS was used to quantify impulsivity.
The authors mention "Hypomanic Personality Scale ‑Short (HPS)", evidencing HPS as the instrument for hypomanic personality characteristics.
"Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale ‑Short (IUS)" is included in the battery, signifying IUS was used to assess intolerance of uncertainty.
The Self-report Measures list contains "Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS)", linking DASS to the measurement of these three constructs.
The questionnaire battery lists "Positive Valence Systems Scale (PVSS)", showing PVSS was the measure for positive valence (reward-related) symptoms.
"Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ)" appears among the measures, indicating PSWQ assessed worry.
